title: Frontend Instrumentation
description: Add comprehensive logging throughout Svelte frontend: UI interactions, store state changes, IPC calls with timing, error boundaries. Complete full-stack tracing capability. Reference: ai_docs/roadmaps/2025-12-17-comprehensive-logging.md chunk 5

comments.author: bytze
comments.text: Needs plan: Run /create_plan after feast-g9w (Chunk 3) is completed

title: Phase 3: Per-module filtering & config
description: Add per-module log level filtering via level_for() from config file. Create example logging.json config. Reference: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-rust-logging-foundation.md Phase 3
close_reason: Implemented per-module log level filtering via level_for() and created logging.example.json config file. All tests pass.

title: Frontend Log Bridge
description: Enable Svelte frontend to send logs through unified backend logging system. Create Tauri command and TypeScript logging utility with matching JSON structure. Consider batching for performance. Reference: ai_docs/roadmaps/2025-12-17-comprehensive-logging.md chunk 2
close_reason: Frontend Log Bridge complete. Implemented: Rust log_from_frontend command, TypeScript Logger with batching (1s/50 entries), console fallback. Verified end-to-end.

comments.author: bytze
comments.text: Needs plan: Run /create_plan after feast-qbp (Chunk 1) is completed

title: Phase 4: Integration tests & documentation
description: Add integration tests for JSON format and config loading. Document logging system. Manual verification of rotation. Reference: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-rust-logging-foundation.md Phase 4
close_reason: Phase 4 complete. All 10 logging tests pass (integration tests for JSON format, special chars, and constants). Example config created in Phase 3. Note: Unrelated test failure in db::recipes::tests::test_update_recipe_instructions is a pre-existing test isolation issue.

title: Correlation IDs & Request Tracing
description: Enable tracing a single user action through the entire stack. Generate correlation IDs on frontend, propagate through Tauri commands, use tracing::Span in Rust. All logs within a request context include the correlation ID. Reference: ai_docs/roadmaps/2025-12-17-comprehensive-logging.md chunk 3

comments.author: bytze
comments.text: Needs plan: Run /create_plan after feast-9ic (Chunk 2) is completed

title: Phase 3: Frontend Log Bridge Integration
description: Wire all components together and verify end-to-end log flow from frontend through backend to log files. Verify JSON format, batching behavior, and console fallback. Plan: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-frontend-log-bridge.md Phase 3
close_reason: Phase 3 complete: End-to-end integration verified. Frontend logs flow through Rust backend to feast.log with correct JSON format and frontend:: prefix. Test code removed.

title: Backend Instrumentation
description: Add comprehensive logging throughout Rust backend: commands (entry/exit, params, timing), database operations (queries, timing, errors), error handling with rich context. Investigate sensitive data patterns and establish redaction. Reference: ai_docs/roadmaps/2025-12-17-comprehensive-logging.md chunk 4

comments.author: bytze
comments.text: Needs plan: Run /create_plan after feast-g9w (Chunk 3) is completed

title: Phase 2: Plugin integration & file rotation
description: Wire up enhanced tauri-plugin-log with JSON formatter, 10MB file size, KeepAll rotation strategy. Update lib.rs plugin configuration. Reference: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-rust-logging-foundation.md Phase 2
close_reason: Implemented Phase 2: Plugin integration with JSON formatter, 10MB file rotation (KeepAll strategy), and multiple targets (LogDir, Stdout, Webview). All tests pass.

title: Weekly meal plan shopping list not showing on page
Rust Logging Foundation
description: Establish core logging infrastructure with tauri-plugin-log enhancement: JSON structured output, size-based rotation (10MB x 5), per-module log levels, and configurable dev/prod modes. Plan: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-rust-logging-foundation.md. Roadmap: ai_docs/roadmaps/2025-12-17-comprehensive-logging.md chunk 1
close_reason: Rust Logging Foundation complete. Implemented: JSON structured logging, 10MB file rotation with KeepAll strategy, per-module log level filtering, runtime config via logging.json, multiple targets (file, stdout, webview). All 10 logging tests pass.

comments.author: bytze
comments.text: Plan created: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-rust-logging-foundation.md. Key decision: Enhancing existing tauri-plugin-log (already in codebase) rather than switching to raw tracing crate. This maintains Tauri ecosystem integration while achieving all requirements (JSON output, rotation, per-module levels, configurable dev/prod).

title: Shopping list not showing items from meal plan - client-side aggregation broken
Phase 2: TypeScript Logging Utility
description: Create TypeScript logging module with batching (1s/50 entries), queue fallback, and clean API (log.info, log.warn, etc). Includes Tauri command wrapper and barrel exports. Plan: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-frontend-log-bridge.md Phase 2
close_reason: Phase 2 complete: Created TypeScript logging utility with batching (1s/50 entries), Logger class with log.info/warn/error/debug/trace API, console fallback. pnpm check passes.

title: Phase 1: Rust Logging Command
description: Create Tauri command log_from_frontend that receives frontend logs and writes them through the backend logging system. Accepts batched FrontendLogEntry structs with level, message, target, and optional structured data. Plan: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-frontend-log-bridge.md Phase 1
close_reason: Phase 1 complete: Created log_from_frontend Tauri command with FrontendLogEntry struct, registered in commands/mod.rs and lib.rs. All 13 logging tests pass.

title: Phase 1: Logging module & JSON formatter
description: Create logging infrastructure module with LogConfig struct, JSON formatter function, and unit tests. Add chrono dependency. Reference: ai_docs/plans/2025-12-17-rust-logging-foundation.md Phase 1
close_reason: Phase 1 complete: logging module created with LogConfig, json_format, and 10 passing tests
